RT @RepDonBeyer Today I led @JECDems in support of the budget resolution offered by @HouseBudgetDems Chair @RepJohnYarmuth. This pandemic has inflicted widespread suffering and death. Our budget resolution creates a path to provide the American people with the big, bold relief they need ASAP. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EtV7EyVXUAEcVjj.png

‚ÄúWe need to move now to get our country and our economy back on track.

The budget resolution before us starts that process.

Today, we are taking a very important step for the American people.  I urge support for this resolution.‚Äù

‚ÄúIn April, when the economy was forced to shut down ‚Äì unemployment reached 14.8%, & when you factor in those who were misclassified as employed but absent from work (rather than unemployed), the unemployment rate was closer to 20% ‚Äì  the highest level since the Great Depression.‚Äù http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EtVWTd1XcAUGxZl.jpg

‚ÄúLow-wage workers have seen employment drop by 20-25 percent.

The unemployment rates for Black and Hispanic workers exceed 9 percent.

The rich have gotten richer. The poor have gotten poorer.

A ‚ÄòK-shaped‚Äô recovery is unacceptable.‚Äù

‚ÄúMake no mistake -- we are digging out of a very, very big hole. Last week, we got the advance ‚Äì or first ‚Äì report on 2020 GDP.  It was ugly. The economy shrank by 3.5 percent last year, the worst economic performance since 1946.‚Äù http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EtVIPYqWQAIvj0F.jpg

‚ÄúWe are experiencing a national emergency. Almost 450,000 Americans dead as a result of COVID-19. More than 90,000 are in the hospital, clinging to life.

This budget resolution gives us the tools we need to rise the challenge of this national emergency ‚Äì and overcome it.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe have the opportunity to #BuildBackBetter‚Äîa more equitable, inclusive, sustainable and green economy.  We need policies that are aligned with the priorities and needs of middle-class families, not geared toward the wealthy and the well connected.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs often said that Budgets are a statement of values. I agree‚Ä¶ The most important value is to save American lives. The second is to restore economic prosperity. The budget resolution is a critical first step to achieving those overarching goals.‚Äù
